title: Unemployed persons worldwide until 2020
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Unemployed persons in millions, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2014 to 2010.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2020 to 2018.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2015.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2015 to 2014.
gold: The statistic shows the number of unemployed persons worldwide from 2010 to 2017 and projections until 2020 . In 2017 , there were about 174.1 million unemployed persons worldwide .
